28_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body: It's a cute idea but you will be held liable for anything illegal going on with your network... I'd suggest getting another router and using that as the open network; then you can have your own private one and a public one. It's as easy as connecting the router to a free ethernet port on your router/modem

> [iyogo887vyg87oy8](#comment_58_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof): Besides, it's not difficult to break into a Wifi device, and if someone does that and then you get done for something they did then good luck explaining it :P

Be careful though; some people cruise around in their cars looking for open networks to fuck with... Be careful
On some more modern routers, you can deploy a guest network that may use a different subnet and are able to limit download speeds
